task.title: Upgrade Eucalyptus Package Repositories
task.shortdesc: This topic describes the steps to upgrade the Eucalyptus package repositories.

ul.li: Before upgrading Eucalyptus packages, we suggest fully updating your systems using yum update where possible.
The configuration should be validated against the Compatibility Matrix for this release.
The prerequisite hardware and software should be in place and available for Eucalyptus.

stepresult.p: If you have previously customized your configuration files, yum returns a warning, and installs the new configuration files with a different name. This preserves your customizations. Before you continue, customize and rename the new Configuration files.
stepresult.note: For larger deployments, use a script to upgrade the component host machines. For example: for host in 28 29 32 33 35 39 40; do echo 192.168.51.$host; ssh 192.168.51.$host 'yum -y update $( rpm -qa | grep euca )' ; done
